title: Osinachinancy
author: Osinachinancy
content: Hello communityI just opened this account here but although I won't say this is the first time am hearing the word Bitcoin before although Bitcointalk itself an entirely new term to me. Bitcoin is almost everywhere in my region and although it is said to be restricted to trade or transact it with fiat bank but still yet it has refused to die low. I won't lie folk I was really skeptical upon seeing and been told by a friend that such community exist where one can go and discuss all about Bitcoin and other related crypto issues, it's really nice to be here although I have about Bitcoin many times from folks all around me and believe me it's definitely hard to miss out on this term but I would count myself still a newbie as my profile even says so and will be willing to learn more about crypto and Bitcoin in particular.Hope I get a warm welcome and I will also try to see it to that many folks that are into Bitcoin come about locating the wonderful forum .

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Welcome to Bitcointalk.What you heard is true, here in Bitcointalk you get the chance to discuss, learn, unlearn and relearn things about bitcoin. If you’re really interested in bitcoin you’re going to enjoy your stay here in the forum. So, before you proceed I’d love to share with you a few links that will get you started and that includes the rules of the forum do well to go through the links so that you won’t encounter any issue that will get your account banned.  Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQ You can still go through the following links below to learn about bitcoin and cryptocurrency as a whole. https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbook#chapters https://www.bitcoin.com/get-started/ https://learnmeabitcoin.com/Beginners & Encyclopaedia

comments.author: Kemarit
comments.body: Quote from: Osinachinancy on August 31, 2023, 07:33:36 PMHello communityI just opened this account here but although I won't say this is the first time am hearing the word Bitcoin before although Bitcointalk itself an entirely new term to me. Bitcoin is almost everywhere in my region and although it is said to be restricted to trade or transact it with fiat bank but still yet it has refused to die low. I won't lie folk I was really skeptical upon seeing and been told by a friend that such community exist where one can go and discuss all about Bitcoin and other related crypto issues, it's really nice to be here although I have about Bitcoin many times from folks all around me and believe me it's definitely hard to miss out on this term but I would count myself still a newbie as my profile even says so and will be willing to learn more about crypto and Bitcoin in particular.Hope I get a warm welcome and I will also try to see it to that many folks that are into Bitcoin come about locating the wonderful forum .First off, welcome to Bitcointalk.Second, it's good that you open an account here so that you can see the crypto is for real. We understand that there are a lot of skeptics just like you. But that is ok, the sooner you admit that this is not a scam or something, the better.I will advise you to go and read a lot from this community. You can ask questions from time to time if you don't understanding something. But reading will be your best weapon here as a starter.And don't forget to read about the rules so that you won't break any that can make your account ban from this community.

comments.author: Dzwaafu11
comments.body: Quote from: Osinachinancy on August 31, 2023, 07:33:36 PMHello communityI just opened this account here but although I won't say this is the first time am hearing the word Bitcoin before although Bitcointalk itself an entirely new term to me. Bitcoin is almost everywhere in my region and although it is said to be restricted to trade or transact it with fiat bank but still yet it has refused to die low. You are welcome, mate. you are the right place to know everything about bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies all you need to is to click here to know about the rules and regulations guiding the forum.You can use to the  beginners and help Encyclopedia to know more about what brought you here after you have done reading the rules and regulations it will help you well. However,  don’t hesitate to ask question anything bothering you not only bitcoin but any other cryptocurrency the forum members are always ready to help the newcomers joining us.

comments.author: letteredhub
comments.body: Quote from: Osinachinancy on August 31, 2023, 07:33:36 PMHello communityI just opened this account here but although I won't say this is the first time am hearing the word Bitcoin before although Bitcointalk itself an entirely new term to me. Bitcoin is almost everywhere in my region and although it is said to be restricted to trade or transact it with fiat bank but still yet it has refused to die low. Just as you candle light up a candle in the house and hide it under the table that's how no instruments of restrictions from the government can make bitcoin lay low or die out. Good things will always sell itself amidst opposing  philosophies.QuoteI won't lie folk I was really skeptical upon seeing and been told by a friend that such community exist where one can go and discuss all about Bitcoin and other related crypto issues, it's really nice to be here although I have about Bitcoin many times from folks all around me and believe me it's definitely hard to miss out on this term but I would count myself still a newbie as my profile even says so and will be willing to learn more about crypto and Bitcoin in particular.Hope I get a warm welcome and I will also try to see it to that many folks that are into Bitcoin come about locating the wonderful forum .You're welcome to the forum bitcointalk.We're family here coming together to learn from one another. Just follow the rules of the forum, be yourself and express your thoughts in an engaging way that it doesn't abuse the next member but build his knowledge.Make yourself useful by knowing more about the forum with this thread. Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQ

comments.author: Mr.suevie
comments.body: Welcome mate to the forum and as my advice to other newbie account that I have come in contact is always about the plain context of reading before ever jumping to conclusions amd contribution, well that's same advice I would give again here, Bitcointalk is a really simple place to thrive especial in terms of all the knowledge that is available here so it's left for you to work your way and tap from so you too can help build the minds of other upcoming crypto enthusiast.

comments.author: Hamza2424
comments.body: Quote from: Osinachinancy on August 31, 2023, 07:33:36 PM__SNIP__Most of the fellows already gave a warm welcome to you so not being redundant I would like to say that if you are really interested in learning you need to struggle here because now most of the topics created in the section whether it's about the Bitcoin Discussion or the Trading or altcoin you will find the topics and questions asked by the Newbies if there is a question then you can find some useful insights by reading the feedbacks o the senior members.I would say that if you want to learn in a better mode you should have to ask seniors, on your local board about the best topics created by the old members.. They can give you references to those threads and after reading a useful thread you can judge the topic by 100 views because there will so many comments on the thread and opinions by different users, This is what I like most about the forum. Its time taking but more efficient. In other way you can ask for the topics after getting engaged with he discussion on any thread, most of the times if senior finds the repitive topic they give the other references as well.Enjoy you journey.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Welcome to the forum, OP.You are not alone in hearing about Bitcoin. The difference is, what exactly did you hear? A lot of people are terrified by this name, thinking that Bitcoin is a scam. Others are too enamored with Bitcoin and believe, believing that Bitcoin will take them out of poverty forever and make them rich.Try to take a sober look at Bitcoin, having learned not only the advantages but also the disadvantages. Draw your own conclusions by reading the topics, of which there are a lot on the forum, and you will probably become a permanent member of this society, acquiring not only the right knowledge about Bitcoin but also many new friends.

comments.author: rozak
comments.body: Quote from: Osinachinancy on August 31, 2023, 07:33:36 PMHope I get a warm welcome and I will also try to see it to that many folks that are into Bitcoin come about locating the wonderful forum .welcome to the forum, reading your story there must be quite a lot of people around you talking about and maybe owning Bitcoin. some people don't like Bitcoin and consider it a scam. I hope that doesn't happen in your environment.in the forum you can discuss everything, If you are interested in investment or trading, you can look for the appropriate board for you to get information.Just a suggestion, When you search and read more information on forums, your knowledge will be richer. many people who invest in Bitcoin don't even know Bitcoin. if you don't have Bitcoin it's not a problem. You can learn first and your investment doors will open someday.

comments.author: Patrol69
comments.body: Welcome to this forum, since you are a new member of this forum, it is natural that such questions come to your mind. You will find the answers to these questions yourself when you spend time on this forum. As a new forum member you must try to learn about this forum. Every day many members express their comments in this forum, if you want you can read those comments well and also if you have to share any information then you can go to the specific section and share your opinion here. When you try to learn something from this forum you can easily learn about those topics from this forum because this forum is very nice and organized where every topic is made separately so that everyone can understand and read easily.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Welcome to The forum, if you're interested in learning about Bitcoin, you have some to the right place, all you have to do is to learn the ground rules and get acquainted to how the forum works.Take note of two rules for a start;• Do not plagiarise• Do not share malware'sUsing this two you should avoid getting banned, another important rule is not to spam. Use the search option when you want to make a post to ensure that your question has not already been answered.The forum is easy to navigate through, just follow the board headers and description that it carries, you should also read through the pinned threads on each board before making a post on it.Good luck on the forum.

comments.author: Bureau
comments.created_time: September 01, 2023, 07:01:27 AMLast edit: September 01, 2023, 07:12:33 AM by Bureau
comments.body: Hello and Welcome to the forum.Although everyone who has replied to your thread before me has shared important links and provided important information to you. Still, I would like to ask one question. Did you read the whitepaper on Bitcoin? You will be able to find almost every information needed to understand Bitcoin, it would be great if you read the whitepaper yourself. It will help you to understand why everyone living in the world should have Bitcoin and what changes it has made to the world. Sharing the link to the Bitcoin whitepaper for you. If English is not your native language, then you might find its translation in your language when you visit that link.

comments.author: Mayor of ogba
comments.body: Quote from: Osinachinancy on August 31, 2023, 07:33:36 PMHello communityI just opened this account here but although I won't say this is the first time I have heard the word Bitcoin before Bitcointalk itself is an entirely new term to me. Bitcoin is almost everywhere in my region and although it is said to be restricted to trade or transact with fiat banks but still yet it has refused to die low. I won't lie folk I was skeptical upon seeing and being told by a friend that such a community exists where one can go and discuss all Bitcoin and other related crypto issues, It's nice to be here although I have about Bitcoin many times from folks all around me and believe me it's definitely hard to miss out on this term but I would count myself still a newbie as my profile even says so and will be willing to learn more about crypto and Bitcoin in particular.Hope I get a warm welcome and I will also try to see that many folks who are into Bitcoin come about to locate the wonderful forum.Welcome to this forum mate, you are on the right path to learning about Bitcoin. You can ask questions in this forum concerning Bitcoin or cryptocurrencies when you are in a difficult situation there are so many people to help with answers.

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: Welcome to the forum.I have read your topic carefully before coming to react to it. According to what you have written, I can say that you are not an absolutely newbie to the Bitcoin community. You have heard about bitcoin and it is right in your neighborhood according to your introduction. Just that the government of your country does not permit that you should trade bitcoin with fiat and yet people maneuver to find their ways which makes bitcoin undying in your residence. I also assume that your friend or whosoever that introduced you to this noble forum has also told you about how things goes here. The regulations and how the forum frowns against cheating, plagiarism and more. So in order to make your friend who brought you to this forum proud, you need to play according to the rules and then remain honest. Find your passion and explore the world of Bitcoin.Welcome once more !

comments.author: Dimitri94
comments.body: You are welcome. What your friend told you that on Bitcointalk forum you can learn about Bitcoin related topics as well as gain good knowledge about various altcoins is true. Bitcoin and crypto related topics are discussed daily in this forum, you can easily share your knowledge and enrich your investment with the knowledge gained from it. Since you are a complete newbie, you will have to get used to a lot of reading. After a certain period of your regular studies hopefully you will get a better understanding of this world.

comments.author: Sim_card
comments.body: This forum has been into existence since 2009,and it has really helped a lot of people to become bitcoin die hard lovers. You friend did a great thing to tell you about the forum as the forum is open to teach everyone various angles of bitcoin and cryptocurrency at large. As a newbie, you should read the topics and articles provided for you by other forum members above. If you want to grow fast don't forget to always use the search engine to search for interested topics and also do your own research. Identify yourself with your local board so that if you understand your local language very well,learning will be easy for you in your local board.

comments.author: reagansimms
comments.body: That's the state of Bitcoin now. As you can see what is happening in the area where you live, Bitcoin has spread everywhere even though it is still restricted by the government. The community's love for Bitcoin is what Bitcoin refuses to die for, Bitcoin has won the trust of all walks of life because of the convenience and advantages that can be generated from storing Bitcoin rather than storing Fiat.Your arrival here will help you increase your knowledge about Bitcoin, here you can discuss and ask Seniors starting from the most basic things to how to choose a safe wallet to store it. Now that you are among the people who really like Bitcoin, start discussing with them to add to your insight on Bitcoin.

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: Quote from: Osinachinancy on August 31, 2023, 07:33:36 PMit's really nice to be here although I have about Bitcoin many times from folks all around me and believe me it's definitely hard to miss out on this term but I would count myself still a newbie as my profile even says so and will be willing to learn more about crypto and Bitcoin in particular.Right before you proceed to learning what brought you here on bitcointalk, you will need to pay a very close attention to details, this begins with you learning about the forum's rules and regulations, this will be what will determine your stay here if really you're law abiding or not, try to accept the challenges that may come along the way while learning because such might be your own efforts and task required while going through the process of learning, which also indicates for being patient and humble while having the perseverance for learning, welcome to the forum.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: Osinachinancy on August 31, 2023, 07:33:36 PMHope I get a warm welcome and I will also try to see it to that many folks that are into Bitcoin come about locating the wonderful forum .You are welcome to the forum. If you have in mind to learn about Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies you are on the right forum. You have to avoid plagiarism and the use of of chatbot in making your post. Ignorance is not an excuse for breaking the law, that is why you have to read the rules of the forum. I will also suggest that you spend time reading different topics in the forum and observing how things are done here before you start posting. This will help you to contribute to the forum in the future. You should also be willing to learn from others and, therefore be willing to accept and learn from constructive criticism. How far you will grow in this forum will be determined by how committed you are to learning and contributing positively to the forum.
